Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Treadmill \Tread"mill`\, n. A mill worked by persons treading upon steps on the periphery of a wide wheel having a horizontal axis. It is used principally as a means of prison discipline. Also, a mill worked by horses, dogs, etc., treading an endless belt. [1913 Webster]

treadmill n 1: an exercise device consisting of an endless belt on which a person can walk or jog without changing place 2: a mill that is powered by men or animals walking on a circular belt or climbing steps [syn: {treadwheel}, {tread-wheel}] 3: a job involving drudgery and confinement [syn: {salt mine}]
